forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 51. Southwest wind 5 to 8 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks gently over Downtown San Francisco, the city greets the day under a cloak of relative clarity, punctuated by just a hint of the marine layer that is bound to linger around the bay. The temperatures hover comfortably around the coolness of early spring, inviting those who venture outside to embrace a day filled with promise. A subtle gust from the southwest stirs the still air, making it a pleasant time for a stroll in the park or a leisurely coffee on a sun-dappled terrace. 

The forecast leads us toward a mostly sunny Tuesday, with temperatures inching up into the low sixties, then falling gradually as the afternoon progresses. Layers will be your friend today; a light jacket or cardigan will serve well against the breezy whispers. With fewer clouds overhead and the sun making a strong case for its presence, it’s a fine opportunity to enjoy some time outdoors. Perhaps one might explore the quiet nooks of the Presidio, savor a book beneath the ancient oaks, or simply indulge in a visit to a local café to watch the world pass by. Embrace the simplicity of a day where a gentle wind carries the fresh scent of the sea, hinting at the vibrant life that pulses through this iconic landscape.
